channel.title: Wolverine Movie
channel.description: What do you think? Was the latest XMen spinoff any good? I just saw it last night and... I had mixed feelings. Of course it did not follow the story to the letter, but I was expecting that. The special effects varied from good to sloppy. Just wondering what everyone else thought of it... I guess overall I would say I liked it.

item.title: Wolverine Movie
item.dc:creator: iKy
item.description:
raw_bean:

You take that back! Wolverine is without doubt overrated in the X-universe but Wolverine and the X-Men is actually a surprisingly good cartoon, and actually seems to follow on pretty well from the awesome 90s X-Men cartoon.

wolverine is not overrated , the big attention is put on him because he is close-to-immortal , he survived most of the mutant generations , and still will , he isn’t especially cool in any way , he just has his role in the first mutations …

Read full topic

item.title: Wolverine Movie
item.dc:creator: Ramirezoid
item.description:
The problem with the version i have that probably ruins a lot of it for me: Half of the CGI is incomplete. The whole ending is bscly Hugh Jackman hanging from strings with texturelesss Sabretooth model fighting some fag that I think is supposed to be deadpool.

Read full topic

item.title: Wolverine Movie
item.dc:creator: OldDirtyBastard
item.description:
First half was pretty damn good. The other one… I don’t know. Anyway, I cannot say I didn’t enjoy it.

Read full topic

item.title: Wolverine Movie
item.dc:creator: Ramirezoid
item.description:
Yesterday, for some reason, my mother came home from the bar with an apparently LEGAL bootleg copy of it on DVD. She says it’s because veterans get to have everything before anybody else does. The movie is pretty cheesy.

God bless America.

Read full topic

item.title: Wolverine Movie
item.dc:creator: Grum
item.description:
Saw the movie. Was better than X-Men 3 but that isn’t saying much. I couldn’t stop laughing when I saw Patrick Stewarts creepy CGI face. “It’s me children, Professor X. Hop in in my chopper now.”

Read full topic

item.title: Wolverine Movie
item.dc:creator: mr.FREEMANZ
item.description:
raw_bean:

You take that back! Wolverine is without doubt overrated in the X-universe but Wolverine and the X-Men is actually a surprisingly good cartoon, and actually seems to follow on pretty well from the awesome 90s X-Men cartoon.

That’s something I wouldn’t normally expect from raw_bean…

item.title: Wolverine Movie
item.dc:creator: Dias
item.description:
I fucking loved the 90’s X-Men cartoon. With the exception of Jean Grey’s character design. Every time I see something wrong in the movies I just end up facepalming and thinking “would it have killed them to fix that detail, it’s more important then they think” or “How do you fuck something up that badly.”

Read full topic

item.title: Wolverine Movie
item.dc:creator: TheeGoatPig
item.description:
Indeed. It would be quite creepy to have a 50 year old Gambit hitting on a 20 year old Rogue.

Read full topic

item.title: Wolverine Movie
item.dc:creator: CatzEyes93
item.description:
raw_bean:

You take that back! Wolverine is without doubt overrated in the X-universe but Wolverine and the X-Men is actually a surprisingly good cartoon, and actually seems to follow on pretty well from the awesome 90s X-Men cartoon.

My oldest used to watch the 90’s X-Men cartoon and I have to admit I rather liked it myself. Which is why I was excited to see Gambit was going to be in the movie cuz I always thought he was a cajun kewl guy. Thing is… didn’t him and Rouge used to kinda almost like each other? Maybe not. Anyway, it wouldnt work well in the current X-Men world would it?

Read full topic

item.title: Wolverine Movie
item.dc:creator: raw_bean
item.description:
OK, I can see how that would get a bit much.

Read full topic

item.title: Wolverine Movie
item.dc:creator: raw_bean
item.description:
SassyRobot:

I still don’t really see why Wolverine is so popular though, there’s even some kids cartoon my little brother watches and it’s called something like “Wolverine and the X-Men”.
Wtf? They may as well call it “The really cool badass with the claws and some freaks he hangs out with who don’t do much except the bits he can’t”. Nevermind.

You take that back! Wolverine is without doubt overrated in the X-universe but Wolverine and the X-Men is actually a surprisingly good cartoon, and actually seems to follow on pretty well from the awesome 90s X-Men cartoon.

Read full topic

item.title: Wolverine Movie
item.dc:creator: TheeGoatPig
item.description:
I enjoyed the hell out of the movie. Gambit was a bit too acrobatic, but I can forgive that for the rest of the fun stuff in the movie.

It’s a hell of a lot better than Xmen 3.

Read full topic

item.title: Wolverine Movie
item.dc:creator: Watevaman
item.description:
Dr. Strangelove:

Deadpool and Gambit? It’s about time

Neither is in for a significant amount of time, though. Gambit got a little more screentime than Deadpool, I believe, but neither was more than 5/10 minutes.

Read full topic

item.title: Wolverine Movie
item.dc:creator: The_Minotaur
item.description:
I found that it wasn’t very exciting. It was more about finding out what happened to Wolverine that it was being a movie. Good if you like facts, bad if you like a good movie.

Read full topic

Deadpool and Gambit? It’s about time

item.title: Wolverine Movie

OH yes that movie was fucking brilliant, I saw it yesterday with a few mates, I totally would reccomend the movie to anyone

item.title: Wolverine Movie
item.dc:creator: Watevaman
item.description:
Well, I don’t read the comics, but I went to see it with friends and I enjoyed it.

The particular method used to destroy the nuclear cooling tower was the greatest I’ve ever seen in a movie. We all laughed.

item.description:
Will probably only want to see it for the Deadpool bits. But then again I don’t watch a lot of movies anyway, so prolly won’t bother at all.

Meh.

Meh.

item.title: Wolverine Movie
item.dc:creator: John_Killer118
item.description:
I don’t plan on seeing it. Mostly because I never really cared much for the X-Men, let alone Wolverine.
Even if I can watch it illegally off the internet, I wouldn’t see it. I’m that uninterested! Besides, people who pirate films are douchebags. And It’sJustSomeRandomGuy would look down upon me:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yTokEDMaDWY
